attributes.action: create traffic calming and safe pedestrian crossings along Ramsay Way, Eastbourne
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Ever since the residential construction in Eastbourne’s South Harbour, Ramsay Way has become a main route used by vehicles travelling in and out of the area, now encasing well over a thousand dwellings.

The 1km stretch of road has a 30mph but has NO pedestrian crossings whatsoever, even though there are 2 schools within 1 mile, numerous within 5 miles, and various nursery schools, all within reach of the residents of this area.

Crossing this road is a concern for all ages, children and the elderly alike – numerous vehicles travel well in excess of 30mph on a regular occasion, leaving little hope for anyone judging their speed and distance.

Further to my 10 year old brother being hit by a vehicle on this road in May 2009, I feel the need to raise awareness of this situation and petition for everyone’s support in this desperate need for safety in our local community.

We suggest road calming measures and appropriately placed pedestrian crossings are applied along the full stretch of road.
